transportAdvice: The town of Banff is compact and walkable, with most attractions, shops, and restaurants reachable on foot. A local transit bus service connects the townsite with nearby areas including Lake Louise, and taxis are available for longer journeys within the national park.

weather.description: Cold and snowy with excellent conditions for skiing and winter activities at nearby resorts.
Still firmly winter with cold temperatures and good snowpack, ideal for winter sports enthusiasts.
Late winter begins to ease slightly but snow remains on the ground and ski season continues.
Spring arrives with fluctuating temperatures, melting snow, and occasional rain or late snowfall.
Mild and increasingly green with wildflowers emerging, though cool evenings and some rain are common.
Pleasant early summer with long daylight hours, though afternoon showers are fairly frequent.
The warmest and busiest month with excellent hiking conditions and vibrant mountain scenery.
Warm and sunny with peak tourist season in full swing and trails at their most accessible.
Autumn brings stunning golden larch foliage and cooler, crisp air with fewer crowds.
Noticeably cooler with early snowfall possible at higher elevations and a quieter atmosphere.
Winter sets in with cold temperatures, early snowfall, and ski resorts beginning to open.
Cold and snowy with a festive atmosphere in town and excellent early-season skiing conditions.
